Interface Group

    public interface Group
extends com.guidewire.pl.domain.community.gen.GroupStubI, Assignee
    Group Groups of users.

    • Method Detail

      • getOpenActivities

        Activity[] getOpenActivities()
        Returns:
        All open activities assigned to this group.

      • getOpenActivityCount

        int getOpenActivityCount()
        Returns:
        Count of all open activities assigned to this group.

      • isSupervisor

        boolean isSupervisor(Key userId)
        Parameters:
        userId - the user to check.
        Returns:
        true iff the userId passed in is the supervisor of this group.

      • isSupervisorInChain

        boolean isSupervisorInChain(Key userId)
        Parameters:
        userId - the user to check
        Returns:
        true iff the userId passed in is the supervisor of this group or one if it's parents.

      • containsUser

        boolean containsUser(User user)
        Returns true if and only if this group contains the given user. Note that a user can be contained in a group, but not be a member. Hence, the group's user set is a (not necessarily strict) superset of its membership.
        See Also:
        isMember(gw.pl.persistence.core.Key), getGroupUser(gw.pl.community.entity.User)

      • isMember

        boolean isMember(Key userID)
        Returns true if and only if the user with the given userId is a member of this group. Note that a user may be contained in a group but may not be a member of the group.
        Parameters:
        userID - the key of the user to check
        Returns:
        true if the user is a member of group, false if not
        See Also:
        containsUser(gw.pl.community.entity.User)

      • removeUser

        boolean removeUser(User user)
        Parameters:
        user -
        Returns:
        true if user was a member of the group, false if not.

      • getUsersNoSystemUsers

        GroupUser[] getUsersNoSystemUsers()
        Returns all the users in this group EXCEPT system users
        Returns:

      • getGroupUser

        GroupUser getGroupUser(User user)
        Gets the GroupUser entry in this group that references the given user. This method compares the user.userID against the group members' to locate a match.
        Parameters:
        user - The user entity to match.
        Returns:
        GroupUser The matching GroupUser entity or null if there is no such GroupUser.
        See Also:
        GroupStubI.getUsers(), containsUser(gw.pl.community.entity.User), isMember(gw.pl.persistence.core.Key)

      • getMembers

        GroupUser[] getMembers()
        Returns all the users in this group that are members (including system users)
        Returns:

      • getChildGroups

        Group[] getChildGroups()
        Returns all of the groups having this group as their parent and which are visible to the caller.

      • getRootGroupId

        Key getRootGroupId()
        Returns the id of the root group.

      • getMembersNoSystemUsers

        GroupUser[] getMembersNoSystemUsers()
        Returns all the users in this group that are members but who aren't system users
        Returns:

      • getMembersNoSystemUsersSortedByName

        GroupUser[] getMembersNoSystemUsersSortedByName()
        Returns all the users in this group that are members, sorted by name
        Returns:

      • getMembersNoSystemUsersAsList

        java.util.List getMembersNoSystemUsersAsList()
        Returns all the users in this group that are members but who aren't system users. Returns a List of User objects, NOT GroupUser objects.
        Returns:

      • isAncestor

        boolean isAncestor(Group maybeChild)
        Returns:
        true this is an ancestor group of the argument

      • getQueue

        Parameters:
        queueName - name of the queue to get
        Returns:
        The named AssignableQueue associated with this, or null if it does not exist...

      • isSafeToDelete

        boolean isSafeToDelete()
        Tests if the group can be safely deleted. Returns false if
        • The group is the root group.
        • The group has any sub-groups.
        • The group has any users.
        Returns:
        True if the user can be safely deleted.

      • getRootGroup

        Group getRootGroup()
        Returns:
        the root group for this group
